Question:
A list of various quantities is shown.
acceleration
displacement
force
length
mass
velocity

How many of these quantities are vectors?

A student determines the circumference of a football.
Which instrument gives a reading that is the circumference of the football?

A train sets off from a station at time t = 0.
The graph shows how the distance between the train and the station varies with time.
Which statement about the movement of the train between time t1 and t2 is correct?

Options.A: Its speed is decreasing and it is moving away from the station.
Options.B: Its speed is decreasing and it is moving towards the station.
Options.C: Its speed is increasing and it is moving away from the station.
Options.D: Its speed is increasing and it is moving towards the station.

Question:
A coin falls from rest through the air and eventually reaches a constant speed.
There is a resultant force acting on the coin due to the two forces P and Q shown in the diagram.
What happens to force P and what happens to the resultant force before the coin reaches constant speed?

Options.A: Force P decreases, Resultant force increases
Options.B: Force P decreases, Resultant force decreases
Options.C: Force P increases, Resultant force decreases
Options.D: Force P increases, Resultant force increases

Question:
A satellite is shown moving around the Earth in a circular path at a constant speed.
Which arrow shows the direction of the force on the satellite?

Which row shows the mass and the weight of an object on the Earth’s surface?
[gravitational field strength g = 10 N / kg]

Water is added to a measuring cylinder containing 100 cm3 of liquid paraffin.
(The density of paraffin is 0.80 g / cm3 and that of the water is 1.0 g / cm3.)
As the water is added, the level of the paraffin rises to 150 cm3. The paraffin and water do not mix.
What finally is the total mass of liquid in the measuring cylinder?

A horizontal beam is pivoted at X. A mass of 200 g rests on the beam as shown. The centre of mass of the beam is 50 cm from the right-hand end of the beam.
The beam is balanced.
What is the mass of the beam?
Where on the graph is the limit of proportionality for an elastic solid?

A sealed gas syringe contains a fixed mass of gas.
The piston is moved and the volume of the gas doubles. The temperature of the gas does not change.
What happens to the pressure of the gas?
Which expression for pressure is correct?

At a depth d in sea-water, the total pressure experienced by a diver is 2P, where P is atmospheric pressure.
At which depth is the pressure 4P?

The work done by a force F on a body is calculated by multiplying F by a quantity q.
What is q?

Options.A: The distance travelled in the direction of the force
Options.B: The distance travelled perpendicular to the direction of the force
Options.C: The velocity in the direction of the force
Options.D: The velocity in the direction perpendicular to the force

Question:
Some solar panels have a total area of 12 m2.
Each 1.0 m2 of the panels receives 0.85 kJ of energy from the Sun in 1.0 s.
The efficiency of the panels is 16%.
How much power do they produce?

A copper rod is heated at one end.
Which statement describes how heat transfer occurs in the copper?

Options.A: Energetic copper molecules move from the cooler end to the hotter end.
Options.B: Energetic copper molecules move from the hotter end to the cooler end.
Options.C: Energetic free electrons move from the cooler end to the hotter end.
Options.D: Energetic free electrons move from the hotter end to the cooler end.

Question:
The diagram shows a clinical thermometer.
Which factor affects the sensitivity of the thermometer?

Options.C: The length of the glass tube
Options.D: The thickness of the glass tube

Question: Which row is correct for a thermocouple thermometer?

Options.A: Measures very high temperatures: No, Responds quickly to change in temperature: No
Options.B: Measures very high temperatures: No, Responds quickly to change in temperature: Yes
Options.C: Measures very high temperatures: Yes, Responds quickly to change in temperature: No
Options.D: Measures very high temperatures: Yes, Responds quickly to change in temperature: Yes

Question:
A radiation detector is placed 5.0 cm from a radioactive source.
The count rate of the radiation is measured.
The detector is now placed 10 cm from the source.
What is the new count rate?

Options.A: one-quarter of the original count rate
Options.C: the same as the original count rate

Question:
The diagram shows the apparatus used to demonstrate the deflection of alpha-particles in an electric field.
What is the charge on an alpha-particle and to which plate is it deflected?
